name: accidental
des: adj. 意外发生的，偶然的： occurring unexpectedly or by chance

name: ad-lib
des: adj. 即兴的： made or done without previous thought or preparation

name: adjunct
des: adj. 即兴的： made or done without previous thought or preparation

name: automatic
des: adj. 自发的，情不自禁的： acting or done spontaneously or unconsciously

name: extemporize
des: v. 即席表现： to do or perform (something) without prior preparation or practice

name: fluky
des: adj. 侥幸的： coming or happening by good luck especially unexpectedly

name: impromptu
des: adj. 即席的，即兴的： composed without previous preparation

name: improvise
des: v. 即兴而作： to invent, compose, or perform with little or no preparation

name: intuitive
des: adj. 直觉的： knowing or perceiving by intuition

name: insight
des: n. 深刻的理解： an instance of apprehending the true nature of a thing, especially through intuitive understanding

name: offhand
des: adj. 即兴的，没有准备的： without premeditation or preparation

name: spontaneous
des: adj. 自发的，不经思索的： acting or activated without apparent thought or deliberation

name: shrink
des: v. 本能性地退却（如因遇到使人惊恐的某物）；退缩： to draw back instinctively, as from something alarming; recoil

name: unwitting
des: adj. 偶然的，并非有意的： happening by chance; not intended

name: calculated
des: adj. 经过计算（成败得失）的，经过深思熟虑的： engaged in, undertaken, or displayed after reckoning or estimating the statistical probability of success or failure

name: commonsensical
des: adj. 符合常识的，有依据的：displaying common sense，based on sound reasoning or information

name: contemplate
des: vt./vi. 沉思，仔细思索： to view or consider with continued attention

name: deliberate
des: adj. 深思熟虑的： characterized by or resulting from careful and thorough consideration

name: measured
des: adj. 深思熟虑的，审慎的： deliberated, calculated

name: meditate
des: vt. 思索，沉思： to focus one’s thoughts on

name: premeditate
des: vi. 预先考虑： to think, consider, or deliberate beforehand

name: reflect
des: vi. 思考： to think seriously

name: ruminate
des: vt. 沉思： to go over in the mind repeatedly and often casually or slowly

name: educated
des: having an education especially : having an education beyond the average <educated speakers> (知识渊博的)

name: knowledgeable
des: having or showing knowledge or intelligence (知识渊博的)

name: learned
des: characterized by or associated with learning : erudite (知识渊博的)

name: lettered
des: learned, educated (知识渊博的)

name: literate
des: educated, cultured (知识渊博的)

name: scholarly
des: of, characteristic of, or suitable to learned persons : learned, academic (知识渊博的)

name: well-read
des: well-informed or deeply versed through reading <well-read in history> (知识渊博的)

name: well-informed
des: 1 : having extensive knowledge especially of current topics and events; 2 : thoroughly knowledgeable in a particular subject (知识渊博的)

name: conversant
des: having knowledge or experience ― used with with (知识渊博的)

name: erudite
des: possessing or displaying erudition : learned <an erudite scholar> (知识渊博的)

name: accomplished
des: proficient as the result of practice or training <an accomplished dancer> also : skillfully done or produced <an accomplished film> (熟练的；有经验的)

name: complete
des: highly proficient (熟练的；有经验的)

name: expert
des: having, involving, or displaying special skill or knowledge derived from training or experience  (熟练的；有经验的)

name: synonyms
des: see proficient (熟练的；有经验的)

name: experienced
des: made skillful or wise through experience : practiced <an experienced driver> (熟练的；有经验的)

name: versed
des: acquainted through study or experience; knowledgeable or skilled (熟练的；有经验的)

name: adept
des: thoroughly proficient : expert <adept at fixing cars>   synonyms see proficient (熟练的；有经验的)

name: consummate
des: extremely skilled and accomplished <a consummate liar> <a consummate professional> (熟练的；有经验的)

name: veteran
des: having had long experience or practice (熟练的；有经验的)

name: abreast
des: up to a particular standard or level especially of knowledge of recent developments (熟练的；有经验的)

name: proficient
des: well advanced in an art, occupation, or branch of knowledge (熟练的；有经验的)

name: dexterous
des: mentally adroit and skillful : clever (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: politic
des: characterized by shrewdness in managing, contriving, or dealing (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: judicious
des: having, exercising, or characterized by sound judgment : discreet   synonyms see wise (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: perspicacious
des: of acute mental vision or discernment : keen (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: sagacious
des: of keen and farsighted penetration and judgment : discerning <sagacious judge of character> (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: tactful
des: having or showing tact (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: diplomatic
des: employing tact and conciliation especially in situations of stress (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: adroit
des: having or showing skill, cleverness, or resourcefulness in handling situations <an adroit leader> <adroit maneuvers> synonyms see clever, dexterous (头脑灵活的，明断的)

name: ignorant
des: resulting from or showing lack of knowledge or intelligence <ignorant errors> （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: unlettered
des: 1 a : lacking facility in reading and writing and ignorant of the knowledge to be gained from books b : illiterate （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: benighted
des: existing in a state of intellectual, moral, or social darkness : unenlightened （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: illiterate
des: having little or no education especially : unable to read or write <an illiterate population> （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: uneducated
des: （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: unscholarly
des: （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: unknowing
des: （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: untutored
des: 1 a : having no formal learning or training b : naive, unsophisticated （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: uninformed
des: （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: unknowledgeable
des: （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: uncivilized
des: not civilized : barbarous （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: unacquainted
des: （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: artless
des: lacking art, knowledge, or skill : uncultured <an artless brute> （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: tactless
des: marked by lack of tact <tactless comments> <tactless methods> （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: artless
des: lacking art, knowledge, or skill : uncultured <an artless brute> （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: innocent
des: ignorant <almost entirely innocent of latin ― c. l. wrenn> （文盲的，没有知识的）

name: untutored
des: ：1 a : having no formal learning or training; b : naive, unsophisticated （单纯幼稚的（+））; 2 : not produced or developed by instruction : native <untutored shrewdness> （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: naive
des: 1.marked by unaffected simplicity （单纯幼稚的（+））; 2.deficient in worldly wisdom or informed judgment especially (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: dewy-eyed
des: naively innocent and trusting <a dewy-eyed optimist> （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: wide-eyed
des: having or marked by unsophisticated or uncritical acceptance or admiration : naive <wide-eyed innocence> （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: artless
des: free from guile or craft : sincerely simple <an artless young woman> （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: innocent
des: lacking or reflecting a lack of sophistication, guile, or self-consciousness : artless, ingenuous （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: guileless
des: innocent, naive （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: unaffected
des: free from affectation : genuine （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: unpretending
des: unpretentious （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: unsophisticated
des: not changed or corrupted : genuine （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: ingenuous
des: showing innocent or childlike simplicity and candidness （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: uncontrived
des: （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: unfeigned
des: not feigned or hypocritical : genuine （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: unforced
des: （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: spontaneous
des: not apparently contrived or manipulated （单纯幼稚的（+））

name: foolish
des: lacking in sense, judgment, or discretion (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: exploitable
des: (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: susceptible
des: open, subject, or unresistant to some stimulus, influence, or agency <susceptible to pneumonia> (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: unwary
des: not alert : easily fooled or surprised : heedless, gullible <cheats unwary tourists> (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: dewy-eyed
des: naively innocent and trusting <a dewy-eyed optimist> (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: wide-eyed
des: having or marked by unsophisticated or uncritical acceptance or admiration : naive (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: innocent
des: lacking or reflecting a lack of sophistication, guile, or self-consciousness : artless, ingenuous (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: unperceptive
des: (易受骗的，愚蠢的（-）)

name: imprudent
des: not prudent : lacking discretion, wisdom, or good judgment <an imprudent investor> （不明智的）

name: injudicious
des: not judicious : indiscreet, unwise <injudicious outbursts> （不明智的）

name: undiplomatic
des: not diplomatic especially : tactless （不明智的）

name: gauche
des: lacking social experience or grace also : not tactful : crude <it would be gauche to mention the subject> （不明智的）

name: impolitic
des: not politic : unwise （不明智的）

name: untactful
des: （不明智的）

name: conforming
des: （正统的,传统保守的）

name: conformist
des: （正统的,传统保守的）

name: conventional
des: : of traditional design （正统的,传统保守的）

name: orthodox
des: 1 a : conforming to established doctrine especially in religion b : conventional （正统的,传统保守的）

name: regular
des: : formed, built, arranged, or ordered according to some established rule, law, principle, or type （正统的,传统保守的）

name: routine
des: : of, relating to, or being in accordance with established procedure <routine business> （正统的,传统保守的）

name: conservative
des: : marked by or relating to traditional norms of taste, elegance, style, or manners <a conservative suit> （正统的,传统保守的）

name: hidebound
des: : having an inflexible or ultraconservative character （正统的,传统保守的）

name: old-fashioned
des: : of, relating to, or characteristic of a past era <wears an old-fashioned black bow tie ― green peyton> （正统的,传统保守的）

name: stodgy
des: : extremely old-fashioned : hidebound （正统的,传统保守的）

name: traditional
des: :of, relating to, or in accord with tradition （正统的,传统保守的）

name: ceremonial
des: : marked by, involved in, or belonging to ceremony （正统的,传统保守的）

name: banal
des: : lacking originality, freshness, or novelty : trite （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: cliché
des: something (as a menu item) that has become overly familiar or commonplace （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: commonplace
des: : something commonly found （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: hack
des: : hackneyed, trite （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: threadbare
des: : exhausted of interest or freshness    synonyms see trite （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: trite
des: : hackneyed or boring from much use : not fresh or original （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: well-worn
des: : made trite by overuse : hackneyed <a well-worn quotation> （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: stereotyped
des: : lacking originality or individuality （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: uncreative
des: （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: unimaginative
des: （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: stodgy
des: : extremely old-fashioned : hidebound <received a pompously victorian letter from his stodgy father ― e. e. s. montagu> （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: familiar
des: :a frequently seen or experienced : easily recognized <a familiar theme> b : of everyday occurrence <a familiar routine> （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: hackneyed
des: : lacking in freshness or originality <hackneyed slogans> （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: time-honored
des: : honored because of age or long usage （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: tired
des: : trite, hackneyed （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: warmed-over
des: : not fresh or new : stale <warmed-over ideas> （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: shopworn
des: : stale from excessive use or familiarity <shopworn clichés> （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: stale
des: : tedious from familiarity <a stale routine> （缺乏创新的,陈旧的）

name: nonconventional
des: (打破传统的)

name: nonorthodox
des: (打破传统的)

name: nontraditional
des: (打破传统的)

name: heterodox
des: : contrary to or different from an acknowledged standard, a traditional form, or an established religion : unorthodox, unconventional <a heterodox  (打破传统的)spirituality> <heterodox ideas> (打破传统的)

name: progressive
des: : making use of or interested in new ideas, findings, or opportunities (打破传统的)

name: radical
des: : marked by a considerable departure from the usual or traditional : extreme (打破传统的)

name: dissentient
des: (打破传统的)

name: dissenting
des: (打破传统的)

name: dissident
des: : disagreeing especially with an established religious or political system, organization, or belief (打破传统的)

name: iconoclastic
des: : a person who attacks settled beliefs or institutions (打破传统的)

name: informal
des: : marked by the absence of formality or ceremony <an informal meeting> (打破传统的)

name: irregular
des: : not conforming to the usual pattern of inflection <irregular verbs> (打破传统的)

name: unconventional
des: : not conventional : not bound by or in accordance with convention : being out of the ordinary <an unconventional outfit> <an unconventional thinker> )(打破传统的)

name: offbeat
des: : eccentric, unconventional （打破传统的）

name: eccentric
des: : adeviating from an established or usual pattern or style <eccentric products> b : deviating from conventional or accepted usage or conduct especially in odd or whimsical ways <an eccentric millionaire> （打破传统的）

name: fresh
des: : original, vivid <a fresh portrayal> (有创造力的,创新的)

name: original
des: : independent and creative in thought or action : inventive <an original artist> (有创造力的,创新的)

name: innovative
des: : characterized by, tending to, or introducing innovations (有创造力的,创新的)

name: novel
des: : original or striking especially in conception or style <a novel scheme to collect money> (有创造力的,创新的)

name: pioneering
des: : original, earliest (有创造力的,创新的)

name: imaginative
des: (有创造力的,创新的)

name: inventive
des: : characterized by invention <an inventive method> (有创造力的,创新的)

name: ingenious
des: : marked by originality, resourcefulness, and cleverness in conception or execution <an ingenious contraption> (有创造力的,创新的)

name: creative
des: : having the quality of something created rather than imitated : imaginative <the creative arts> (有创造力的,创新的)

name: artful
des: (有创造力的,创新的)

name: liberal
des: : broad-minded especially : not bound by authoritarianism, orthodoxy, or traditional forms （思维宽广的）

name: casual
des: （思维宽广的）

name: open-minded
des: : receptive to arguments or ideas （思维宽广的）

name: unceremonious
des: : not ceremonious （思维宽广的）

name: freewheeling
des: : free and loose in form or manner （思维宽广的）

name: concrete
des: SPECIFIC, PARTICULAR (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: distinct
des: distinguishable to the eye or mind as discrete : SEPARATE (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: distinctive
des: having or giving style or distinction (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: precise
des: distinguished from every other (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: special
des: distinguished by some unusual quality especially : being in some way superior (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: specific
des: a : restricted to a particular individual, situation, relation, or effect  b : exerting a distinctive influence (as on a body part or a disease)  (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: rare
des: 1. marked by unusual quality, merit, or appeal : DISTINCTIVE ；2. superlative or extreme of its kind（非凡的）；3. seldom occurring or found : UNCOMMON (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: exceptional
des: forming an exception : RARE (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: unique
des: a : being without a like or equal : UNEQUALED b : distinctively characteristic : PECULIAR (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: peculiar
des: 1 : characteristic of only one person, group, or thing : DISTINCTIVE ；2 : different from the usual or normal: a : SPECIAL, PARTICULAR b : ODD, CURIOUS c : ECCENTRI (特殊的，不同于其他的)C, QUEER（古怪的）

name: especial
des: being distinctive: as a : directed toward a particular individual, group, or end ；b : of special note or importance : unusually great or significant c : highly dis (特殊的，不同于其他的)tinctive or personal : PECULIAR e : SPECIFIC, PARTICULAR

name: particular
des: 1 : of, relating to, or being a single person or thing；2 : distinctive among other examples or cases of the same general category : notably unusual (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: anomalous
des: inconsistent with or deviating from what is usual, normal, or expected : IRREGULAR, UNUSUAL (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: dissident
des: disagreeing especially with an established religious or political system, organization, or belief (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: dissentient
des: expressing dissent (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: dissenting
des: of or relating to the English Nonconformists (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: heterodox
des: contrary to or different from an acknowledged standard, a traditional form, or an established religion : UNORTHODOX, UNCONVENTIONAL (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: unorthodox
des: not orthodox (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: iconoclastic
des: characterized by attack on established beliefs or institutions（特立独行的） (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: iconoclast
des: n. a person who attacks settled beliefs or institutions（特立独行的人） (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: idiosyncrasy
des: n. an individualizing characteristic or quality （独特而奇怪的习惯） (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: maverick
des: n. an independent individual who does not go along with a group or party；  a. characteristic of, suggestive of, or inclined to be a maverick (特殊的，不同于其他的)

name: infrequent
des: seldom happening or occurring : RARE （罕见的）

name: rare
des: seldom occurring or found : UNCOMMON （罕见的）

name: seldom
des: in few instances : RARELY, INFREQUENTLY （罕见的）

name: uncommon
des: not ordinarily encountered : UNUSUAL （罕见的）

name: unfamiliar
des: not well-known : STRANGE （罕见的）

name: unusual
des: not usual : UNCOMMON, RARE （罕见的）

name: unwonted
des: being out of the ordinary : RARE, UNUSUAL （罕见的）

name: infrequent
des: seldom happening or occurring : RARE （罕见的）

name: inadequate
des: not adequate : INSUFFICIENT （罕见的）

name: scanty
des: limited or less than sufficient in degree, quantity, or extent （罕见的）

name: scarce
des: deficient in quantity or number compared with the demand: not plentiful or abundant （罕见的）

name: inimitable
des: not capable of being imitated : MATCHLESS (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: incomparable
des: eminent beyond comparison : MATCHLESS (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: matchless
des: having no equal : PEERLESS (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: peerless
des: MATCHLESS, INCOMPARABLE (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: unparalleled
des: having no parallel especially : having no equal or match : unique in kind or quality (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: extraordinary
des: a : going beyond what is usual, regular, or customary b : exceptional to a very marked extent (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: rare
des: superlative or extreme of its kind (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: exceptional
des: better than average : SUPERIOR (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: exceeding
des: exceptional in amount, quality, or degree (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: remarkable
des: worthy of being or likely to be noticed especially as being uncommon or extraordinary (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: phenomenal
des: EXTRAORDINARY, REMARKABLE   (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: sublime
des: tending to inspire awe usually because of elevated quality (as of beauty, nobility, or grandeur) or transcendent excellence（令人惊叹的） (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: astonishing
des: causing astonishment : SURPRISING (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: astounding
des: causing astonishment or amazement (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: fabulous
des: a : resembling or suggesting a fable : of an incredible, astonishing, or exaggerated nature b : WONDERFUL, MARVELOUS (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: miraculous
des: of the nature of a miracle : SUPERNATURAL (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: portentous
des: eliciting amazement or wonder : PRODIGIOUS (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: prodigious
des: exciting amazement or wonder (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: staggering
des: so great as to cause one to stagger : ASTONISHING, OVERWHELMING (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: stunning
des: strikingly impressive especially in beauty or excellence (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: stupendous
des: causing astonishment or wonder : AWESOME, MARVELOUS (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: terrific
des: EXTRAORDINARY (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: wonderful
des: , amazing (无与伦比的，非凡的，不可思议的)

name: aberrant
des: deviating from the usual or natural type : ATYPICAL （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: abnormal
des: deviating from the normal or average : UNUSUAL, EXCEPTIONAL （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: erratic
des: deviating from what is ordinary or standard : ECCENTRIC （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: bizarre
des: strikingly out of the ordinary as odd, extravagant, or eccentric in style or mode （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: eccentric
des: deviating from an established or usual pattern or style （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: offbeat
des: ECCENTRIC, UNCONVENTIONAL （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: outlandish
des: strikingly out of the ordinary : BIZARRE （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: out-of-the-way
des: UNUSUAL （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: peculiar
des: ECCENTRIC, QUEER  （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: quaint
des: a : unusual or different in character or appearance : ODD <figures of fun, quaint people ― Herman Wouk> b : pleasingly or strikingly old-fashioned or unfamiliar  （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: queer
des: differing in some odd way from what is usual or normal （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: screwy
des: crazily absurd, eccentric, or unusual （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: spaced-out
des: of very strange character : WEIRD （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: way-out
des: FAR-OUT: marked by a considerable departure from the conventional or traditional （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: weird
des: of strange or extraordinary character : ODD, FANTASTIC （异常的，反常的，古怪的）

name: COMMONPLACE
des: commonly found or seen : ORDINARY, UNREMARKABLE （平凡，普通）

name: PROSAIC
des: EVERYDAY, ORDINARY （平凡，普通）

name: NORMAL
des: a : according with, constituting, or not deviating from a norm, rule, or principle b : conforming to a type, standard, or regular pattern （平凡，普通）

name: ORDINARY
des: of a kind to be expected in the normal order of events : ROUTINE, USUAL （平凡，普通）

name: UNEXTRAORDINARY
des: （平凡，普通）

name: USUAL
des: accordant with usage, custom, or habit : NORMAL （平凡，普通）

name: UNEXCEPTIONAL
des: not out of the ordinary : COMMONPLACE （平凡，普通）

name: PLAIN
des: a : belonging to the masses : COMMON b : lacking special distinction or affectation : ORDINARY （平凡，普通）

name: STOCK
des: commonly used or brought forward : STANDARD （平凡，普通）

name: routine
des: : a regular course of procedure （平凡，普通）

name: standard
des: : regularly and widely used, available, or supplied （平凡，普通）

name: universal
des: present or occurring everywhere （平凡，普通）

name: unimposing
des: lacking in impressiveness （平凡，普通）

name: unimpressive
des: not capable of impressing （平凡，普通）

name: mediocre
des: of moderate or low quality, value, ability, or performance : ORDINARY, SO-SO （平凡，普通）

name: conformer
des: a person who act in accordance with prevailing standards or customs（循规蹈矩的人） （平凡，普通）

name: conformist
des: 循规蹈矩的人 （平凡，普通）

name: COMMON
des: a : WIDESPREAD, GENERAL <common knowledge> b : characterized by a lack of privilege or special status （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: GENERAL
des: a : applicable to or characteristic of the majority of individuals involved : PREVALENT b : concerned or dealing with universal rather than particular aspects （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: UBIQUITOUS
des: existing or being everywhere at the same time : constantly encountered : WIDESPREAD （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: OMNIPRESENT
des: present in all places at all times （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: CONFORMITY
des: correspondence in form, manner, or character （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: SAMENESS
des: the quality or state of being the same : IDENTITY, SIMILARITY （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: PANDEMIC
des: occurring over a wide geographic area and affecting an exceptionally high proportion of the population （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: WIDESPREAD
des: widely diffused or prevalent （常见的，普遍的，流行的）

name: CONVENTIONAL
des: 1. lacking originality or individuality : TRITE 2. ORDINARY, COMMONPLACE (传统的，陈腐的)

name: BATHETIC
des: characterized by bathos (传统的，陈腐的)

name: HACKNEYED
des: lacking in freshness or originality (传统的，陈腐的)

name: CUSTOMARY
des: commonly practiced, used, or observed (传统的，陈腐的)

name: PRESCRIPTION
des: N. ancient or long continued custom（传统的规矩） (传统的，陈腐的)

name: CONSERVATIVE
des: tending or disposed to maintain existing views, conditions, or institutions : TRADITIONAL (传统的，陈腐的)

name: HIDEBOUND
des: having an inflexible or ultraconservative character (传统的，陈腐的)

name: OLD-FASHIONED
des: of, relating to, or characteristic of a past era (传统的，陈腐的)

name: STODGY
des: extremely old-fashioned : HIDEBOUND (传统的，陈腐的)

name: TRADITIONAL
des: (传统的，陈腐的)

name: ORTHODOX
des: a : conforming to established doctrine especially in religion b : CONVENTIONAL (传统的，陈腐的)

name: antithetical
des: adj. 完全对立的，相反的： being in direct and unequivocal opposition (对立的)

name: belie
des: v. 与…相对立；与…相矛盾： to be counter to; contradict (对立的)

name: polarize
des: vt. 使分开对立，两极分化： to break up into opposing factions or groupings (对立的)

name: ambivalent
des: adj. （尤指感情、态度）矛盾的： having a mixture of opposing feelings （矛盾的）

name: contradict
des: vt. 否认，反驳；相矛盾： to assert the contrary of; to imply the opposite or a denial of  （矛盾的）

name: discrepancy
des: n. （在事实和宣称之间的）差异或矛盾： divergence or disagreement, as between facts or claims  （矛盾的）

name: oxymoron
des: n. 矛盾修饰法： a combination of contradictory or incongruous words  （矛盾的）

name: paradox
des: n. 表面矛盾实际可能正确的话，悖论： a statement that is seemingly contradictory or opposed to common sense and yet is perhaps true  （矛盾的）

name: schism
des: n. 不一致： a lack of agreement or harmony  (不一致)

name: variance
des: n. 不一致，不和谐： a lack of agreement or harmony  (不一致)

name: dissonance
des: n．不和谐，刺耳： a harsh, disagreeable combination of sounds; discord  (不一致)

name: discord
des: n. 意见不一致，不和谐： lack of agreement or harmony (as between persons, things, or ideas)  (不一致)

name: abnegate
des: v. 否认： deny, renounce（放弃）（拒绝，否定）

name: disavow
des: vt. 拒绝承认，否认： to disclaim knowledge of, responsibility for, or association with；to declare not to be true（拒绝，否定）

name: gainsay
des: v. 否认： to declare false （拒绝，否定）

name: naysay
des: vt. 拒绝，否认： to oppose, deny, or take a pessimistic or negative view of （拒绝，否定）

name: negation
des: n. 否定： the opposite or absence of something regarded as actual, positive, or affirmative （拒绝，否定）

name: refute
des: vt. 否认： to declare not to be true （拒绝，否定）

name: repudiate
des: vt. 否认： to declare not to be true （拒绝，否定）

name: rebuff
des: vt. 严词拒绝： to reject or criticize sharply （拒绝，否定）

name: retract
des: vt. 收回，否认： to take back （拒绝，否定）

name: reprobate
des: vt. 拒绝，不提供： to be unwilling to grant （拒绝，否定）

name: repulse
des: vt. （使）厌恶，排斥： to rebuff or reject with rudeness, coldness, or denial （拒绝，否定）

name: spurn
des: vt. 摈弃，拒绝： to reject with disdain or contempt （拒绝，否定）

name: veto
des: n./vt. 否决，禁止： to forbid or prohibit authoritatively（拒绝，否定）

name: bifurcate
des: vi./vt. （使）分成两支： (to cause) to divide into two branches or parts (分歧)

name: chasm
des: n. 分歧，意见、利益或忠诚上的明显差异： a pronounced difference of opinion, interests, or loyalty. (分歧)

name: dissension
des: n. 意见不合：difference of opinion; disagreement (分歧)

name: dichotomy
des: n. 一分为二，分割： a division into two especially mutually exclusive or contradictory groups or entities (分歧)

name: dissent
des: v. 持异议，不同意： to differ in opinion (分歧)

name: discord
des: n. 意见不一致，不和谐： lack of agreement or harmony (as between persons, things, or ideas) (分歧)

name: friction
des: n. 冲突，不和： the clashing between two persons or parties of opposed views (分歧)

name: heresy
des: n. 异教，和普遍观点相悖： a controversial or unorthodox opinion or doctrine, departure from a generally accepted theory, opinion, or practice (分歧)

name: heterodox
des: adj. 非正统的，异端的： holding unorthodox opinions or doctrines, not rigidly following established form, custom, or rules(分歧)

name: confound
des: v. 证明为假，证伪：to prove to be false （证明为假）

name: debunk
des: v. 证明为假： to prove to be false （证明为假）

name: disprove
des: vt. 证伪，证明为假： to prove to be false or wrong （证明为假）

name: refute
des: vt. 证明为假，证伪： to prove wrong by argument or evidence: show to be false or erroneous （证明为假）

name: bifurcate
des: vi./vt. （使）分成两支： (to cause) to divide into two branches or parts  (一致的)

name: chasm
des: n. 分歧，意见、利益或忠诚上的明显差异： a pronounced difference of opinion, interests, or loyalty.  (一致的)

name: dissension
des: n. 意见不合：difference of opinion; disagreement  (一致的)

name: dichotomy
des: n. 一分为二，分割： a division into two especially mutually exclusive or contradictory groups or entities  (一致的)

name: dissent
des: v. 持异议，不同意： to differ in opinion  (一致的)

name: discord
des: n. 意见不一致，不和谐： lack of agreement or harmony (as between persons, things, or ideas)  (一致的)

name: friction
des: n. 冲突，不和： the clashing between two persons or parties of opposed views  (一致的)

name: heresy
des: n. 异教，和普遍观点相悖： a controversial or unorthodox opinion or doctrine, departure from a generally accepted theory, opinion, or practice  (一致的)

name: heterodox
des: adj. 非正统的，异端的： holding unorthodox opinions or doctrines, not rigidly following established form, custom, or rules (一致的)

name: accord
des: n. 一致： a state of consistency  (一致的)

name: agreeable
des: adj. 相一致的： being in harmony  (一致的)

name: amenity
des: n. 融洽，和谐：the quality of being pleasant or agreeable  (一致的)

name: consensus
des: n. 一致同意： general agreement; unanimity  (一致的)

name: kindred
des: adj. 类似的；具有相似或相近的起源，本性或性质的： having a similar or related origin, nature, or character  (一致的)

name: assent
des: vi. 同意：to agree to something especially after thoughtful consideration （证明为真，承认）

name: attest
des: vt. 证实，为…作证： to give evidence or testimony to the truth or factualness of （证明为真，承认）

name: aver
des: v. 声称为真： to state as a fact usually forcefully （证明为真，承认）

name: affirm
des: vt. 声称为真，肯定属实： to assert (as a judgment or decree) as valid or confirmed （证明为真，承认）

name: avowal
des: n. 承认： a solemn and often public declaration of the truth or existence of something （证明为真，承认）

name: accede
des: v. 赞成： to express approval or give consent （证明为真，承认）

name: acquiesce
des: v. 勉强同意；默许： to accept, comply, or submit tacitly or passively （证明为真，承认）

name: assert
des: vt. 断言，肯定地说出：to state or declare positively and often forcefully or aggressively （证明为真，承认）

name: acknowledge
des: vt. 承认： to admit the existence, reality, or truth of （证明为真，承认）

name: contend
des: vt. 声明，声称： to state as a fact usually forcefully （证明为真，承认）

name: consent
des: n. 同意，赞同： the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something （证明为真，承认）

name: consensus
des: n. 一致同意： general agreement; unanimity （证明为真，承认）

name: complementary
des: adj. 互补的： mutually supplying each other’s lack （证明为真，承认）

name: corroborate
des: vt. 用证据或权威证实： to support with evidence or authority; make more certain （证明为真，承认）

name: concede
des: vt. 承认：to grant as a right or privilege （证明为真，承认）

name: claim
des: v. 断言：to state as a fact usually forcefully （证明为真，承认）

name: favorable
des: adj. 赞许的：expressing approval （证明为真，承认）

name: ratify
des: vt. （官方地）认可，批准： to give official acceptance of as satisfactory （证明为真，承认）

name: sanction
des: v. 批准，同意，认可： to make valid or binding usually by a formal procedure (as ratification) （证明为真，承认）

name: substantiate
des: vt. 证实： to support with proof or evidence （证明为真，承认）

name: verify
des: vt. 校验，证实： to determine or test the truth or accuracy of, as by comparison, investigation, or reference （证明为真，承认）

name: vindicate
des: vt. 证明，证实：to give evidence or testimony to the truth or factualness of （证明为真，承认）

name: complex
des: a whole made up of complicated or interrelated parts （复杂,纠缠）

name: complexity
des: （复杂,纠缠）

name: complicate
des: 1 : to combine especially in an involved or inextricable manner; 2 : to make complex or difficult; 3 : INVOLVE especially : to cause to be more complex or severe <a virus disease complicated by bacterial infection> （复杂,纠缠）

name: perplex
des: to make intricate or involved （复杂,纠缠）

name: sophisticate
des: to make complicated or complex （复杂,纠缠）

name: sophisticated
des: （复杂,纠缠）

name: snarl
des: 1 : to cause to become knotted and intertwined : TANGLE; 2 : to make excessively complicated (复杂,纠缠)

name: ensnarl
des: to involve in a snarl (复杂,纠缠)

name: tangle
des: to unite or knit together in intricate confusion (复杂,纠缠)

name: tangled
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: entangle
des: to wrap or twist together (复杂,纠缠)

name: entanglement
des: a : the action of entangling : the state of being entangled b : something that entangles, confuses, or ensnares (复杂,纠缠)

name: ravel
des: to become entangled or confused (复杂,纠缠)

name: interlace
des: to unite by or as if by lacing together (复杂,纠缠)

name: intertwine
des: to unite by twining one with another (复杂,纠缠)

name: intertwist
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: interweave
des: to mix or blend together (复杂,纠缠)

name: knot
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: knotty
des: marked by or full of knots especially : so full of difficulties and complications as to be likely to defy solution (复杂,纠缠)

name: baroque
des: characterized by grotesqueness, extravagance, complexity, or flamboyance (复杂,纠缠)

name: byzantine
des: intricately involved (复杂,纠缠)

name: convoluted
des: having convolutions (复杂,纠缠)

name: elaborate
des: marked by complexity, fullness of detail, or ornateness (复杂,纠缠)

name: intricate
des: having many complexly interrelating parts or elements (复杂,纠缠)

name: involved
des: a : marked by extreme and often needless or excessive complexity b : difficult to deal with because of complexity or disorder (复杂,纠缠)

name: involvement
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: labyrinthine
des: of, relating to, or resembling a labyrinth : INTRICATE, INVOLVED (复杂,纠缠)

name: embarrass
des: to make intricate (复杂,纠缠)

name: embarrassment
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: fancy
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: lavish
des: expending or bestowing profusely (复杂,纠缠)

name: twisted
des: mentally or emotionally unsound or disturbed (复杂,纠缠)

name: circumstantial
des: marked by careful attention to detail : abounding in factual details (复杂,纠缠)

name: minute
des: marked by close attention to details (复杂,纠缠)

name: particular
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: particularized
des: to go into details (复杂,纠缠)

name: imbroglio
des: an intricate or complicated situation  (复杂,纠缠)

name: misunderstanding
des: 困境，复杂的局面 (复杂,纠缠)

name: quandary
des: (复杂,纠缠)

name: clarify
des: to make (as a liquid) clear or pure usually by freeing from suspended matter  (简单的)

name: clear
des: (简单的)

name: elucidate
des: to give a clarifying explanation (简单的)

name: untangle
des: to loose from tangles or entanglement (简单的)

name: unravel
des: to resolve the intricacy, complexity, or obscurity of (简单的)

name: unsnarl
des: to disentangle a snarl in (简单的)

name: untwine
des: to unwind the twisted or tangled parts of (简单的)

name: untwist
des: to separate the twisted parts of (简单的)

name: disentangle
des: to free from entanglement (简单的)

name: extricate
des: to free or remove from an entanglement or difficulty (简单的)

name: plain
des: something free from artifice, ornament, or extraneous matter  (简单的)

name: simple
des: (简单的)

name: simplify
des: (简单的)

name: streamline
des: to make simpler or more efficient (简单的)

name: straightforward
des: free from evasiveness or obscurity (简单的)

name: austere
des: markedly simple or unadorned (简单的)

name: uncomplicated
des: not complicated by something outside itself  (简单的)

name: sketchy
des: wanting in completeness, clearness, or substance (简单的)

name: brief
des: (简单的)

name: compendious
des: marked by brief expression of a comprehensive matter (简单的)

name: summary
des: done without delay or formality (简单的)

name: facilitate
des: to make easier (简单的)

name: ease
des: freedom from labor or difficulty (简单的)

name: expedite
des: to accelerate the process or progress of  (简单的)

name: forward
des: moving, tending, or leading toward a position in front also : moving toward an opponent's goal (简单的)

name: further
des: to a greater degree or extent (简单的)

name: help
des: (括号内的单词意思是：使变容易，促进) (简单的)

name: easy
des: (简单的)

name: effortless
des: showing or requiring little or no effort (简单的)

name: disinterested
des: free from selfish motive or interest  (不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: impartial
des: not partial or biased : treating or affecting all equally  (不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: dispassionate
des: not influenced by strong feeling especially : not affected by personal or emotional involvement  (不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: indifferent
des: marked by impartiality : UNBIASED(不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: impersonal
des: not engaging the human personality or emotions(不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: objective
des: a. expressing or dealing with facts or conditions as perceived without distortion by personal feelings, prejudices, or interpretations; b. of a test : limited to choices of fixed alternatives and reducing subjective factors to a minimum(不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: unbiased
des: having an expected value equal to a population parameter being estimated (不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: unprejudiced
des: Free from prejudice; impartial  (不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: open-mindedness
des: (不带感情的，无个人偏见的)

name: equal
des: regarding or affecting all objects in the same way   （公平的，平等的）

name: equitable
des: dealing fairly and equally with all concerned （公平的，平等的）

name: evenhanded
des: Showing no partiality; fair.   （公平的，平等的）

name: square
des: just,fair   （公平的，平等的）

name: nonpartisan
des: not partisan especially : free from party affiliation, bias, or designation (无党派的，中立的)

name: neutrality
des: the quality or state of being neutral especially : refusal to take part in a war between other powers (无党派的，中立的)

name: aboveboard
des: free from all traces of deceit or duplicity  (无欺诈的，光明正大的)

name: just
des: honorable and fair in one's dealings and actions (正派的，公正的)

name: biased
des: exhibiting or characterized by bias especially : PREJUDICED (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: nonobjective
des: not objective (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: one-sided
des: limited to one side : PARTIAL (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: partial
des: inclined to favor one party more than the other : BIASED (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: partisan
des: inclined to favor one side over another (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: prejudiced
des: resulting from or having a prejudice or bias for or especially against (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: discriminating
des: marked by discrimination (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: discriminatory
des: applying or favoring discrimination in treatment (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: tendentious
des: marked by a tendency in favor of a particular point of view : BIASED (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: subjective
des: (1) : peculiar to a particular individual : PERSONAL <subjective judgments> (2) : modified or affected by personal views, experience, or background <a subjective account of the incident> (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: favoritism
des: n. the showing of special favor : PARTIALITY (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: favor
des: n. a special privilege or right granted or conceded (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: cronyism
des: n. partiality to cronies especially as evidenced in the appointment of political hangers-on to office without regard to their qualifications  任人唯亲，对好朋友的偏袒(尤指政治上) (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: distorting
des: (有偏见的，带有个人情感的)

name: unfair
des: 1 : marked by injustice, partiality, or deception : UNJUST; 2 : not equitable in business dealings （不公平的）

name: unjust
des: characterized by injustice : UNFAIR （不公平的）

name: inequitable
des: not equitable : UNFAIR （不公平的）
